TidyConsultant

TidyConsultant.Rmd
library(TidyConsultant)
library(tidyverse)

Analyze data properties with validata 

insurance %>% 
  diagnose()
#> # A tibble: 7 × 6
#>   variables types     missing_count missing_percent unique_count unique_rate
#>   <chr>     <chr>             <int>           <dbl>        <int>       <dbl>

#> 2 sex       character             0               0            2     0.00149
#> 3 bmi       numeric               0               0          548     0.410

#> 5 smoker    character             0               0            2     0.00149
#> 6 region    character             0               0            4     0.00299
#> 7 charges   numeric               0               0         1337     0.999
insurance %>% 
  diagnose_numeric()

Analyze data relationships with autostats 

insurance %>% 
  auto_cor() -> cors

cors
#> # A tibble: 12 × 4
#>    x        y           cor  p.value
#>    <chr>    <chr>     <dbl>    <dbl>
#>  1 age      bmi      0.109  6.19e- 5
#>  2 age      children 0.0425 1.20e- 1
#>  3 age      charges  0.299  4.89e-29
#>  4 bmi      age      0.109  6.19e- 5
#>  5 bmi      children 0.0128 6.41e- 1
#>  6 bmi      charges  0.198  2.46e-13
#>  7 children age      0.0425 1.20e- 1
#>  8 children bmi      0.0128 6.41e- 1
#>  9 children charges  0.0680 1.29e- 2
#> 10 charges  age      0.299  4.89e-29
#> 11 charges  bmi      0.198  2.46e-13
#> 12 charges  children 0.0680 1.29e- 2

Arrange correlations in order of significance

cors %>% 
  distinct(cor, .keep_all = T) %>% # removes the duplicate correlations
  arrange(p.value)
#> # A tibble: 6 × 4
#>   x        y           cor  p.value
#>   <chr>    <chr>     <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1 age      charges  0.299  4.89e-29
#> 2 bmi      charges  0.198  2.46e-13
#> 3 age      bmi      0.109  6.19e- 5
#> 4 children charges  0.0680 1.29e- 2
#> 5 age      children 0.0425 1.20e- 1
#> 6 bmi      children 0.0128 6.41e- 1

Analyze the relationship between categorical and continuous variables

insurance %>% 
  auto_anova(everything(), baseline = "first_level") -> anovas1

anovas1 %>% 
  print(n = 50)
#> # A tibble: 32 × 12
#>    target   predictor level   estimate target_mean     n std.error level_p.value

Arrange the relationships by significance

anovas1 %>% 
  select(target, predictor, level, estimate, target_mean, level_p.value, level_significance) %>% 
  filter(level %>% str_detect("(Intercept)", negate = TRUE)) %>% 
  arrange(level_p.value) %>% 
  filter(level_p.value < .1)
#> # A tibble: 5 × 7
#>   target  predictor level    estimate target_mean level_p.value level_significa…
#>   <chr>   <chr>     <chr>       <dbl>       <dbl>         <dbl> <chr>           
#> 1 charges smoker    yes     23616.        32050.      8.27e-283 ***             
#> 2 bmi     region    southe…     4.18         33.4     3.28e- 20 ***             
#> 3 bmi     region    southw…     1.42         30.6     1.99e-  3 **              
#> 4 charges sex       male     1387.        13957.      3.61e-  2 *               
#> 5 bmi     sex       male        0.565        30.9     9.00e-  2 .

From this we can conclude that smokers and males incur higher insurance charges. It may be beneficial to explore some interaction effects, considering that BMI’s effect on charges will be sex-deoendent.

explore model-based variable contributions 

insurance %>% 
  tidy_formula(target = charges) -> charges_form

charges_form
#> charges ~ age + sex + bmi + children + smoker + region
#> <environment: 0x7fdc58b43d58>
insurance %>% 
  auto_variable_contributions(formula = charges_form)
#> Loading required namespace: broom.mixed

insurance %>% 
  auto_model_accuracy(formula = charges_form)
#> Warning: `step_modeimpute()` was deprecated in recipes 0.1.16.
#> Please use `step_impute_mode()` instead.
#> This warning is displayed once every 8 hours.
#> Call `lifecycle::last_lifecycle_warnings()` to see where this warning was generated.
#> Warning: `step_medianimpute()` was deprecated in recipes 0.1.16.
#> Please use `step_impute_median()` instead.
#> This warning is displayed once every 8 hours.
#> Call `lifecycle::last_lifecycle_warnings()` to see where this warning was generated.
